noun.description: An act or instance of shaking the head, especially as used to express disapproval, a negative response to a question, etc. Compare to shake one's head.
A ritualized or instinctive act of shaking the head on the part of an animal, especially as part of the mutual courtship or greeting display of a pair of birds.

origin: Early 17th century; earliest use found in William Shakespeare (1564–1616), playwright and poet. From head + shake.
